data.title: Explosion in Maharashtra, India Results in Multiple Fatalities
data.description: An explosion occurred in Maharashtra, India, on March 1, resulting in at least 15 fatalities. According to Jin10, local police reported that the blast took place at an energy company site, with over a dozen individuals sustaining injuries. Further details have not yet been disclosed.

data.title: Hong Kong Prepares for Financial Uncertainty Amid Global Tensions
data.description:
Hong Kong's Financial Secretary, Paul Chan, has stated that while direct trade and investment between Hong Kong and Iran are limited, the ongoing conflict has introduced significant global uncertainty. According to RTHK, Chan mentioned in a television program that financial markets are expected to experience considerable volatility, with rapid shifts in capital flows. He noted that local funds might seek safe havens in Hong Kong, prompting the Special Administrative Region government to prepare and carefully manage financial risks, with contingency plans already in place.

The conflict may also temporarily impact gold prices, oil prices, and international trade transportation costs, with authorities continuously assessing these risks. Additionally, the budget proposal includes a plan to allocate a total of HKD 150 billion from the Exchange Fund over two years to support the Northern Metropolis and other infrastructure projects. Chan highlighted that the Northern Metropolis covers a large area, accounting for one-third of Hong Kong's land, and includes residential units and commercial land, requiring substantial infrastructure investment. The Exchange Fund generates annual profits, allowing for a shift from financial investment to future-oriented investments.

Chan anticipates that returns from the Northern Metropolis will become evident in approximately four to five years, emphasizing that financial returns should not be the sole focus. The Northern Metropolis is expected to foster future economic growth and serve as a vital residential area for citizens. He stressed that resources should not be concentrated solely on the Northern Metropolis, but also allocated to finance and trade sectors.

Regarding support measures, commonly referred to as "sweeteners," Chan stated that three factors must be considered: necessity, the prevailing economic and social conditions, and public finances.

data.title: Ethereum Spot ETFs Recorded Weekly Net Inflows of $80.46 Million, with Grayscale's ETHE Leading with $40.4688 Million in Net Inflows
data.description: According to data from SoSoValue, Ethereum spot ETFs recorded net inflows of $80.46 million during this week's trading sessions (from February 23 to February 27, Eastern Time).The Ethereum spot ETF with the highest net inflows this week was the Grayscale Ethereum Trust (ETHE), with weekly net inflows of $40.4688 million, according to Odaily. To date, ETHE has recorded cumulative historical net outflows of $5.15 billion. Following closely was the Fidelity ETF (FETH), with weekly net inflows of $39.4843 million. FETH's cumulative historical net inflows now stand at $2.5 billion.The Ethereum spot ETF with the highest net outflows this week was the BlackRock ETF (ETHA), with weekly net outflows of $41.7752 million. ETHA's cumulative historical net inflows currently amount to $11.83 billion.As of the time of writing, the total net asset value of Ethereum spot ETFs is $10.96 billion. The ETF net asset ratio (the proportion of ETF market capitalization relative to Ethereum's total market cap) has reached 4.72%, with cumulative historical net inflows totaling $11.6 billion.

data.title: Bitcoin Spot ETFs Record Weekly Net Inflows of $787 Million, BlackRock's IBIT Leads with $503 Million Inflows
data.description: According to SoSoValue data, Bitcoin spot ETFs recorded net inflows of $787 million during this week's trading sessions (February 23 to February 27, Eastern Time).BlackRock's ETF IBIT saw the highest net inflows among Bitcoin spot ETFs this week, with weekly net inflows reaching $503 million, according to Odaily. IBIT's cumulative historical net inflows now stand at $61.81 billion. Grayscale's Bitcoin Trust GBTC followed with weekly net inflows of $89.4264 million. GBTC's cumulative historical net outflows currently total $25.87 billion.As of the time of writing, the total net asset value of Bitcoin spot ETFs is $83.4 billion, with an ETF net asset ratio (market cap as a percentage of Bitcoin's total market cap) reaching 6.36%. The cumulative historical net inflows have reached $54.8 billion.

data.title: The Iranian Revolutionary Guard claimed that a missile struck the Israeli General Staff headquarters.
data.description: Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps stated that its missile struck the Israeli General Staff headquarters. (Xinhua)

data.title: XRP Spot ETFs See Significant Inflows This Week
data.description: XRP spot ETFs experienced a notable net inflow of $9.55 million during the trading week from February 23 to February 27, according to SoSoValue data. According to PANews, the Bitwise ETF XRP led the inflows with $5.8079 million, bringing its total historical net inflow to $370 million. The Franklin ETF XRPZ followed with a weekly net inflow of $3.001 million, reaching a historical total of $333 million.As of the latest update, the total net asset value of XRP spot ETFs stands at $983 million, with an ETF net asset ratio of 1.19% compared to XRP's total market capitalization. The cumulative historical net inflow has reached $1.24 billion.

data.title: Cryptocurrency Market Rebounds Amid Geopolitical Tensions
data.description: On March 1, the cryptocurrency market experienced a significant rebound during early Asian trading hours following reports of Iranian Supreme Leader Khamenei's death in a U.S.-Israeli military operation. According to BlockBeats, Bitcoin surged by 2.21% to reach $68,196 before settling around $67,300, after a previous day's decline of 3.8%. Ethereum also saw a rise of 4.58%, surpassing the $2,000 mark.Data indicates that after losing approximately $128 billion in market value the previous day, the crypto market recovered about $32 billion by Sunday morning. Analysts suggest that due to the 24/7 trading nature of cryptocurrencies, Bitcoin acted as a 'liquidity pressure valve' during the weekend's geopolitical conflict escalation, absorbing selling pressure that might have otherwise spread to stock, bond, and commodity markets.Despite the rebound, uncertainty remains as Iran has retaliated against multiple locations, including Israel, Qatar, UAE, and Bahrain, and has threatened further strikes on U.S.-related bases. Some traders believe that true price discovery may occur once U.S. stock markets and Bitcoin ETFs resume trading on Monday.The derivatives market also experienced significant volatility. Analysis shows that Bitcoin derivatives saw a surge in sell-off volume of approximately $1.8 billion in a single hour last Saturday, indicating a rise in short-term risk aversion. Meanwhile, tokenized commodity contracts linked to oil, gold, and silver on decentralized trading platform Hyperliquid also saw price increases.

data.title: The Israeli military claims to have completed a new round of airstrikes against Iran, targeting approximately 30 targets.
data.description: The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) have completed a new round of airstrikes against Iranian ballistic missile launchers and air defense systems. The IDF stated that on the night of the 28th, dozens of fighter jets struck approximately 30 targets, including air defense systems, missile launchers, and other military installations. (Jinshi)

data.title: Iran launched a new round of missiles at Israel; the Israeli military claims its defense system has been activated.
data.description: Iran launched a new wave of missiles at Israel. The Israel Defense Forces subsequently confirmed that they had detected missiles launched from Iran and heading towards Israeli territory, and that their defense systems were intercepting the threat. Israel stated that its frontline command had issued preventative instructions to residents in the affected areas, requiring them to move into protected areas and stand by upon receiving an alert. Earlier reports indicated that Iran had attacked a US military base in northern Iraq, with witnesses reporting thick smoke rising from the base. The situation continues to develop. (Tehran Times)

data.title: GEOPOLITICS | Middle East Conflict Threatens Major Disruption in Gas Markets
data.description: A growing conflict in the Middle East is poised to cause substantial disruptions in global gas markets, marking the most significant upheaval since Russia's invasion of Ukraine four years ago. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting concerns over the potential impact on international trade and energy supplies. Analysts warn that escalating tensions could lead to increased volatility and uncertainty in the energy sector, affecting prices and supply chains worldwide. The situation underscores the fragile nature of global energy markets and the potential for geopolitical events to influence economic stability.

data.title: Air India Reduces Regular Flights Amid Middle East Tensions
data.description: Air India has announced a reduction in its regular flight operations due to ongoing monitoring and careful assessment of the situation in the Middle East. According to Jin10, the airline is taking precautionary measures in response to the current geopolitical tensions in the region. This decision reflects the airline's commitment to ensuring passenger safety and operational efficiency amid uncertain conditions. The move comes as airlines globally are adjusting their operations in response to evolving geopolitical landscapes.

data.title: XRP Spot ETFs See Significant Inflows This Week
data.description:
XRP spot ETFs experienced substantial inflows during the trading week from February 23 to February 27, according to Odaily. Data from SoSoValue indicates a net inflow of $9.55 million into XRP spot ETFs. The Bitwise ETF XRP led the inflows with $5.8079 million, bringing its historical total net inflow to $370 million. Following closely, the Franklin ETF XRPZ saw a weekly net inflow of $3.001 million, with its historical total net inflow reaching $333 million.

As of the latest report, the total net asset value of XRP spot ETFs stands at $983 million, with an ETF net asset ratio of 1.19% compared to XRP's total market capitalization. The cumulative historical net inflow for XRP spot ETFs has reached $1.24 billion.

data.title: Crypto jumps after Supreme Court blocks tariffs
data.description:
Crypto markets rallied after the Supreme Court struck down Trump’s tariff regime, lifting bitcoin and major tokens alongside crypto-related stocks.
source: https://catenaa.com/markets/cryptocurrencies/crypto-jumps-after-supreme-court-blocks-tariffs/

data.title: Russia Launches Terror Probe Into Telegram CEO Durov In Criminal Case
data.description:
Russia has opened a criminal investigation into Telegram CEO Pavel Durov, accusing him of enabling terrorist-related content. Telegram has resisted removing content flagged as extremist, prompting ongoing operational restrictions, while Durov maintains the platform meets moderation standards. The case underscores global tensions between online privacy and state regulation. The post Russia Launches Terror Probe Into Telegram CEO Durov In Criminal Case first appeared on The Shib Daily
source: https://news.shib.io/2026/03/01/russia-launches-terror-probe-into-telegram-ceo-durov-in-criminal-case/

data.title: OpenAI Founder Discusses Constitutional Compliance in Military Orders
data.description: OpenAI founder Sam Altman addressed concerns regarding the execution of potentially unconstitutional orders from the U.S. Department of Defense. According to Jin10, Altman stated that he does not foresee such a situation occurring. He emphasized that if OpenAI were certain an order was unconstitutional, they would not comply with it. Altman highlighted his belief that military personnel tend to be more loyal to the Constitution than the general public. He also noted that OpenAI, as a company, should not operate above the U.S. Constitution.

data.title: Increased Defense Spending May Lead to Political Interference and Margin Challenges
data.description: The Wall Street Journal (Markets) posted on X that rising defense budgets could result in heightened political involvement and potential negative impacts on profit margins. As governments allocate more funds to defense, companies in the sector may face increased scrutiny and pressure from political entities. This situation could lead to challenges in maintaining profitability, as political agendas might influence business operations and decision-making processes. The article suggests that while increased spending can boost revenue for defense contractors, it also brings complexities that could affect their financial performance.

data.title: PRECIOUS METALS | Silver Usage in Missiles: Misconceptions and Reality
data.description: A report from CPM Group highlights misconceptions about silver usage in missiles. According to Jin10, some promoters have claimed that missiles worldwide consume large amounts of silver in a non-recoverable manner, with assertions that each 'Tomahawk' missile contains 482 or 500 ounces of silver. However, informed sources reveal that the actual silver content in a 'Tomahawk' missile is approximately 10 to 15 ounces, primarily found in solder and ignition batteries, rather than the exaggerated figures. Smaller missiles used in regions like Ukraine and the Middle East reportedly contain less than an ounce of silver, also located in solder and ignition batteries.

data.title: Kalshi CEO Addresses Market Rules Amid Khamenei's Death Speculation
data.description:
Kalshi CEO Tarek Mansour recently discussed the speculation surrounding Ayatollah Khamenei's death and related prediction market events on X. According to Odaily, Mansour emphasized that Kalshi does not list markets directly tied to death. Instead, they design rules to prevent profit from such outcomes.

In response to the event concerning 'Khamenei stepping down as Supreme Leader,' Kalshi will implement specific measures:

1. All fees for this market will be refunded.

2. For users who opened positions before Khamenei's death, settlements will be based on the last trading price before his passing.

3. Users who opened positions after Khamenei's death will receive full compensation for their costs.

Mansour further assured, "No user will lose a dollar in this market. We will settle the market based on the last transaction price before Khamenei's death, which was at 1:14 AM Eastern Time today."

data.title: GEOPOLITICS | Global Leaders Urge Swift Resolution to Middle East Crisis
data.description: Global leaders have emphasized the need for a prompt resolution to the ongoing crisis in the Middle East. Bloomberg posted on X that U.S. allies have expressed support for the decision to target Iran's supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei. The situation has drawn international attention, with various nations advocating for diplomatic efforts to address the tensions. The focus remains on finding a peaceful solution to the conflict, as the region continues to experience instability.
